title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 690.2 - Clerk of court may divulge to governmental agencies papers and records on applications for admission to the bar
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 690.2 - Clerk of court may divulge to governmental agencies papers and records on applications for admission to the bar

State Regulations

The clerk of the Appellate Division of
the Supreme Court, second judicial department, is hereby authorized, without
further court order, to divulge and make available to any department, agency, board, bureau, court or judge of the Federal, State or local governments, upon
an appropriate written request, the papers and records on any application to
said court for admission to the bar and on any motion incident or related to
such application. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
690.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
